intro: Poranthera cicatricosa, commonly known as the scarred sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, characterized by its showy, bilaterally symmetrical flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, and its flowers range in color from white to pink. Poranthera cicatricosa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in areas with limited water availability.
